etymologies: late 17th century: from Latin calorificus, from calor ‘heat’

definitions: relating to the amount of energy contained in food or fuel

examples.text: she knew the calorific contents of every morsel

shortDefinitions: relating to amount of energy contained in food or fuel

definitions: (of food or drink) containing many calories and so likely to be fattening

examples.text: there is fruit salad for those who can resist the more calorific concoctions

shortDefinitions: containing many calories and so likely to be fattening
